content: On June 13, 1979, Atlanta Braves pitcher Phil Niekro achieved a remarkable milestone by recording his 150th career victory. The knuckleballer, known for his unique pitching style, led the Braves to a 4-3 win over the San Francisco Giants, solidifying his status as one of the franchise's all-time greats. Niekro would go on to win 268 games in his illustrious career, becoming the franchise's all-time leader in wins.
